job_title: Development Associate in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Loved working for a great cause and enjoyed how family oriented the organization is.
cons: Pace of change is often slower due to the fact that so many opinions need to be considered. So the work environment can be frustrating at times.

pros: The people who work here are so hard working and lovely it pains me to see them in this situation.
cons: There are so many opportunities for the nonprofit to grow and get used to being in the 21st century but the management team don't seem very interested in listening and changing. There is little to no planning done for anything which makes everything seem done last minute and rushed. It is really easy for employees to just not work. This should be what performance improvement plans should be for and not just punishing employees who are "on their way out" or have an issue with management.
Can be very stressful and emotional overwhelming

job_title: Community Organizer in Long Beach, CA
pros: Waste of funding and management are not experts.
cons: You are never sure if you will lose your job. Funding is so bad, and there hasn’t been a raise in 3 years.

job_title: Outreach Coordinator in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Some opportunity to schedule your day.
cons: Bad company events (low budget so there’s not enough food to feed the company LOL), fake family environment (no one outside your office will know your name or even care about you), watching how public funding goes to waste in your program

job_title: Treatment Counselor in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Staff are very supportive and take great care of each other
cons: Management...especially incompetent IT that tried to "micromanage" staff

pros: Family-like environment, client-oriented, caring, makes you feel like you are making a difference
cons: Stressful, Emotional, at times hectic, and difficult

pros: AADAP helps the community with drug prevention and sobriety as well as gang prevention and employment services.
cons: Staff can be underpaid and not compensated for their talents and sharp skills.

pros: Very Busy Workplace so job security.

review_title: Make Things Up and Hope for the Best
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Los Angeles, CA
pros: There are actual people who know what they're doing. You have to find them. Once you find them, hang on to them, store their phone numbers, and you will thrive.
cons: I was disappointed to see County funding going to this organization. The organization needs to clean house, and let go of those unqualified OR train existing staff. Work plan yield little results but the low standards of the organization would say they're successful.

review_title: Good company for the industry, but much to be refined
job_title: Residential Staff in Los Angeles, CA
pros: People helping people, fulfilling job if you want to help others, amazing health benefits, you won't get bored
cons: Super low pay (but that's inclusive of industry), no personal life if you work directly with clients, basically no work-life balance, favoritism over actual skills when making decision to "promote within"

pros: Clients and co-workers, Benefits and insurance, flexible schedule (case by case), locations
cons: caseloads (case by case), hearing client's tragic story, depending on funding

job_title: Youth Outpatient Treatment Counselor in Los Angeles, CA
cons: Salary is very Less.  If Salary is better people will love to stay longer to work
Nothing place is good to go
